Target: OntoDevice is an ontology for describing devices, their capabilities and properties.

Comment: An object designed and manufactured to perform one or more functions.
A sensor is a device that detects and responds to some type of input from the physical environment.
A microcontroller is an integrated circuit (IC) designed to handle a specific task in embedded systems.
An electrical/mechanical machine that accomplish some household functions, such as cleaning or cooking.
A device built to accurately detect and display a quantity in a form readable by a human being.
A portable telephone that can make and receive calls over a radio frequency link.
A transducer that converts sound into an electrical signal.
An optical instrument that can capture an image.
A device, either on land or sea, with instruments and equipment for measuring atmospheric conditions to provide information for weather forecasts and to study the weather and climate.
A tag that uses a form of electronic identification technology (Bluetooth, RFID etc).
A device that measures magnetic field or magnetic dipole moment.
A tool that measures proper acceleration.
A device that measures the amount of electric energy consumed by a residence, a business, or an electrically powered device.
A device that measure and communicate water usage from consumer to provider to facilitate water management and proper billing.
A device for measuring air quality.
A device for measuring the flow of oil.
A device that is composed of one or more Sensors together with a MicroController.
A sensor that is able to measure the level of illuminance.
A sensor that is able to measure the concentration of carbon dioxide gas in the atmosphere.
A sensor that is able to measure the level of humidity in the atmosphere.
A sensor that is able to measure hotness and coolness and converts it into an electrical signal.
A sensor used to gather information from an RFID tag, which is used to track individual objects.
A sensor that detect minute localized changes in the force of Earth’s gravity caused by variations in rock or other materials’ density underground.
A GPS Sensor or Receiver is a device used within Earth’s planetary atmosphere to determine its precise geographical location.
A portable computer device that combines mobile telephone and computing functions into one unit.
A device that is usually used for the preservation of items like food via temperature regulation.
An electronic tag that exchanges data with a RFID reader through radio waves.
A passive RFID tag that functions via the electromagnetic energy that gets transmitted from the RFID reader.
An active RFID tag that requires batteries for operation.
Survival Range describes Survival Properties of a device under some specified conditions.
Operating Range describes normal Operating Properties of a device under some specified conditions.
System Capability describes normal measurement, actuation, sampling properties such as accuracy, range, precision, etc. of a System under some specified Conditions such as a temperature range.
A System Property is an identifiable and observable characteristic that represents the System's ability to operate its primary purpose.

Accuracy is the maximum difference that will exist between the actual value (which must be measured by a primary or good secondary standard) and the indicated value at the output of a measurement device (e.g. sensor).
Measurement range is the range that a measurement device can perform measurement.
Precision is the degree of reproducibility of a measurement.
Resolution is the smallest detectable incremental change of input parameter that can be detected in the output signal.
Sensitivity is the minimum input of physical parameter that will create a detectable output change.
Sampling Frequency is the number of samples that a measurement device can produce per second .
Conditions that affects the properties of a device and its operations.
Operating Property is an identifiable characteristic that represents how the device operates under the specified Conditions.
The value of a quality that is non-numerical and can be observed but not measured.
A Quality refers to the characteristic or feature of something (Colour, Status etc).
The current state or situation of something.
The current state of something on whether it is inside or outside of something else like a location.
The current state of something on whether it is turned on or off at the moment.
The ratio of working power, measured in kilowatts (kW), to apparent power, measured in kilovolt amperes (kVA).
